result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Court reporter transcript invoice for sentencing 5/9/16 paid by county $39.00 for files 15cf672/606/1161
5/9/16 - Sentencing Hearing
Case - Dismissed and read in.

Minutes:  15CF606/15CF672/15CF1161.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  

15CF606 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

15CF1161 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

15CF672 - case dismissed & read-in on State's motion.

Sentencing set over to 5/9/16 @ 3pm.  Court would like to review the PSI from 12CF224 and request a memo from deft's previous agent.
Final pre-trial on April 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Minutes:  15CF606/15CF672/15CF1161.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Carl Johnson appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft.  Defense requests an adjournment; State takes no position.  For the reasons set forth on the record, the Court will adjourn the cases for one week.  FPT set for 4/5/16 @ 11am
Final pre-trial on March 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Hrg for 3/7/16 will be rescheduled to accommodate the funeral of Hon. Michael Wilk
Status conference at 03-07-2016 01:30 pm
Emails about scheduling jh

Minutes:  15CF606/672.  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Atty Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carl Johnson.  State requests an adjournment; this case needs to proceed after the Dominique Bryant case.  Status for these two cases is set for 1/25/16 @ 1:15pm.

Email received from Atty Carl Johnson requesting different plea date than 10/22/15 due to deft's work orientation.  Plea hrg set for 10/21/15 @ 10:45am.  Attys notified via email.  Defense counsel will let his client know
Jury selection at 11-30-2015 09:00 am
Final pre-trial at 10-22-2015 10:45 am
State requests an adjournment; unavailability of a witness.  No objection by the State.  FPT 10/22/15 @ 10:45am, JS 11/30/15 @ 9am

Br. 3 clerk to set up FPT with Atty Johnson.   /dls

Minutes:  15CF672/15CF606.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Carl Johnson appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft.  BW authorized; $10,000 cash bond each count.  Prior bond forfeited.  Cases to remain on for JS on 9/28/15 in languished state.

State appears by ADA Jim Kruas. Defendant in person with Atty Carl Johnson. Waiver. Offer stated on record. Bond continued. Pretrial 9/16/15 at 9:20. Jury Selection 9/28/15 at 9:00 a.m. 
Information received. Plea of not guilty entered. Bond continued.
